frankenstein.title: Frankenstein; or, The Modern Prometheus
frankenstein.author: Mary Shelley
frankenstein.summary: The novel tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

dracula.title: Dracula
dracula.author: Bram Stoker
dracula.summary: An epistolary novel, it relates the story of Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England so that he may find new blood and spread the undead curse.

mobydick.title: Moby-Dick; or, The Whale
mobydick.author: Herman Melville
mobydick.summary: The narrative of Ishmael's whaling voyage on the Pequod, commanded by the obsessive Captain Ahab who seeks revenge on the white whale Moby Dick.

prideandprejudice.title: Pride and Prejudice
prideandprejudice.author: Jane Austen
prideandprejudice.summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England.

sherlockholmes.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
sherlockholmes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
sherlockholmes.summary: A collection of twelve short stories featuring Sherlock Holmes, the world's most famous consulting detective, and his friend Dr. Watson.
